description: From Italian bravo. Doublet of brave.

nouns.description: bravo (plural bravos or bravoes or bravi)

entries.meaning: (plural "bravi") A hired soldier; an assassin; a desperado.
examples: Because the headache will always be there, a weapon that never wears out and is as deadly as the bravoâ€™s rapier or Lucrezia's poison vial.

entries.meaning: (international standards, plural "bravos") Alternative letter-case form of Bravo from the NATO/ICAO Phonetic Alphabet.

verbs.description: bravo (third-person singular simple present bravos or bravoes, present participle bravoing, simple past and past participle bravoed)

entries.meaning: To cheer or applaud, especially by saying bravo!
